result.execSummary:
The defendant Lewis L Terry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees by 04-04-2017 or civil judgment will be entered WITHOUT TAX INTERCEPT.
-Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

***Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. FORTHWITH. Court will grant expungement FORTHWITH, upon submission of motion.
With credit for 3 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lewis L Terry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ***Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. FORTHWITH. Court will grant expungement FORTHWITH, upon submission of motion.

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve THREE (3) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for THREE (3) days time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees BY 04-04-2017 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITHOUT TAX INTERCEPT.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  FORTHWITH.  Court will grant expungement FORTHWITH, upon submission of motion.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Lewis L Terry in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant had a significant loss in the family that caused him to lose focus with his DPA.  Defense advised that Defendant is gainfully employed AND is in compliance with MOST of the terms of his DPA.  Court went off the Record to hold sidebar with Counsel.  Defense conferred with the Defendant.  Hearing proceeded on the Record.  The Defendant would like to REVOKE himself from the Agreement.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance AND motion of the Defendant, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
Matter is RESCHEDULED to 04-04-2016 at 01:30 pm before Br. 33.  sdg

Defendant Lewis L Terry in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court admonished Defendant for positive UA's.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Lewis L Terry in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State advised that if Defendant cannot test negative the agreement may be revoked.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court admonished the Defendant for testing positive.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Lewis L Terry in court with attorney Debra J Patterson for Colin P. McGinn.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg

Matter before the Court to address JusticePoint Violation.  Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court admonished Defendant for testing positive AND the refusal from today (02-04-2016).  Matter remains calendared for 02-15-2016 at 08:30am for Review.
JusticePoint DPA Non-compliance Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Lewis L Terry in court with attorney Barbara K Due for Colin P. McGinn.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant has located employment.  Court holds colloquy with Defendant.  Court adjourned matter to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint DPA Non-compliance Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Lewis L Terry in court with attorney Debra Patterson for Colin P. McGinn.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense reports that Defendant has lost his previous employment due to conflicts with JusticePoint.  Defendant is currently residing with his Mother and will be focusing on completing Community Service.  State would like to see a series of negative drug tests.  Court adjourns matter to Br. 33 for final Review hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report dated 10-16-2015.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Lewis L Terry in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant has been testing negative.  Attendance for Thinking for sChange meetings has not been consistent.  Case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lewis L Terry in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Filed, signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  The court reviewed the Agreement with the defendant.  
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction for a period of 6 months.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and found it to be in the best interest of the parties and the general public.
Case adjourned for Review Hearing in Branch 33, Room 113 of the Safety Building.

  Review hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lewis L Terry in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Statements by defense that case may resolve with Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 46.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lewis L Terry in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  
Defendant Lewis L Terry in custody.  
Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
